ACT
68
Croatian register of wills
The fact that a will has been drawn up, stored and declared is recorded in the Croatian register of wills.
The register of wills referred to in paragraph 1 of this article is maintained by the Croatian Chamber of Notaries in accordance with the rules to be prescribed by the ordinance of the minister responsible for judicial affairs.
At the request of the testator, the following shall submit the data from paragraph 1 of this article to the Croatian register of wills:
1. competent courts,
2. notaries public,
3. lawyers,
4. persons who made a will.
The Croatian register of wills is a public register from which data cannot be made available to anyone before the testator's death, except for the testator or a person specially authorized by him.
The fact that the will was not recorded in the Croatian Register of Wills, nor stored anywhere else, does not harm its validity.
